Crimes.Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act violations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant's citizenship application proceed while subject to an admissibility hearing under IRPA?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), Citizenship Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Security concerns and IRPA s. 44(1) report alleging FARC ties
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate entitlement to remedy
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 14(1.1) of the Citizenship Act bars citizenship determination during admissibility hearings
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Motion for document production denied; motion to dismiss granted
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: No effective remedy available until admissibility hearing concludes
Crimes.Review_Standard: Standard of review on judicial review is reasonableness
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicant entitled to fair process but statutory bar applies
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Seeking mandamus to compel citizenship determination
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Statutory bar under s. 14(1.1) prevents processing
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Alleged ties to FARC, a terrorist entity

Crimes.Crime_Name: Potential security concerns under the Citizenship Act
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Citizenship application delay due to security screening
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a citizenship application proceed while the applicant is subject to an admissibility hearing under IRPA?
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Security concerns leading to IRPA report
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show eligibility and procedural unfairness
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Nature and duration of security screening
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 14(1.1) of the Citizenship Act prohibits citizenship determination during admissibility proceedings
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable delay due to unresolved security concerns
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: No relief granted due to statutory bar
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Delay in processing despite permanent resident status

Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility due to association with a terrorist entity
Crimes.Violation_Type: Inadmissibility under IRPA for association with terrorist organization
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can the applicant pursue a mandamus application while subject to deportation proceedings?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant alleged to have ties to FARC, leading to security inadmissibility
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No effective remedy possible during admissibility proceedings
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Initiated admissibility hearing and deportation process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Delayed citizenship due to alleged FARC association
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Motions for document production and dismissal considered
Crimes.Evidence_Used: IRPA s. 44(1) report, intelligence or investigative findings
Crimes.Application_Basis: Citizenship application pending at time of inadmissibility finding
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Linkage to FARC based on security intelligence
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: None identified — statutory bar applies regardless
Crimes.Cause_Description: Suspected association with FARC leading to inadmissibility
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Classified or sensitive information likely involved
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s. 44(1) – Inadmissibility on security grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Access to evidence limited due to national security
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal jurisdiction over immigration and citizenship
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Based on security report under IRPA
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Statutory bar prevents citizenship determination during admissibility process
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Limited disclosure due to national security
